author: sotillo
title: #24 PP-Vox-PAR incluyen la asignatura de religión para la media académica del Bachillerato - Aragón
text:
talkesia arainfo.org
Es inconstitucional, España, aunque aún no lo parezca, es un estado aconfesional y en consecuencia se está vulnerando el artículo 16 de la constitución.
Hay que denunciar todos y cada uno de los ataques a nuestra democracia.
Sinceramente, esto es una puta aberración.
Un disparate que sólo puede provenir de los enfermizos seguidores de esas sectas destructivas que basan su razón de ser en la existencia de seres imaginarios.
Equiparar las creencias personales de gente que parece experimentar auténticas alucinaciones del mundo real con las creencias procedentes del resultado de milenios de investigación y que han llegado a consensos cuasi irrefutables, es decir los que proceden de la ciencia, es una auténtica mostruosidad y da una idea de hasta que punto de regresión se está llevando a cabo con esta panda de facinerosos salvajes.
Es una iniciativa, no una ley. Y como ley no puede ser aporobada porque contraviene la ley marco, que es estatal. Brindis al sol, titular tendencioso.
Voto errónea.
#11 No puedes votar errónea por que presentarlo lo han presentado, que necesiten clases para entenderlo ya es cosa suya y de su guía espiritual

author: Online Editors
title: Threat of snow prompts inspection for Sunday meeting at Naas
text:
Threat of snow prompts inspection for Sunday meeting at Naas
Sunday's Grade One card at Naas will have to pass an inspection at 7.30am on raceday if it is to go ahead.
The fixture is highlighted by the Lawlor's of Naas Novice Hurdle, a top-level contest won by the likes of Envoi Allen and Bob Olinger in recent years, with able support from the Grade Two Racing Post Novice Chase.
Clerk of the course Brendan Sheridan reported the course to be raceable on Friday despite an overnight frost, but with snow a possibility on Saturday night, he felt it prudent to assess conditions on Sunday.
He said: "The ground at Naas is currently soft and fit for racing. There is a grass frost at present but that will clear quite quickly today.
"Having spoken with Met Eireann this morning, the forecast for Saturday night into Sunday morning is for rain, sleet or snow. There is an uncertainty at present what will fall so in light of that forecast we will have a 7.30am inspection here at Naas on Sunday morning."
Tuesday's meeting at Leicester is already under threat with an inspection also called for Sunday morning.
Officials will assess conditions at 7.45am as the track is reported to be waterlogged with rain or snow forecast on Saturday night.
Friday's card at Musselburgh was called off in controversial circumstances after the track failed to pass a third inspection.
Following checks at 8am and 10.15am, officials took a final look at noon before a long deliberation saw the meeting eventually called off just under 10 minutes ahead of the first race, which was scheduled for 12.27pm.
Saturday's card at Newcastle is also off with the track frozen and no prospect of sufficient improvement.

author: Richard Nieva
title: Why The DOJ Is Trying To Curtail Google’s AI Future
text:
Late on Wednesday, the U.S. Department of Justice filed sweeping proposals for remedies in Google’s landmark antitrust case, where a federal judge ruled earlier this year that it has an illegal monopoly in the online search market. Among the marquee requests: Forcing Google to sell off its popular Chrome browser, banning multi-billion dollar distribution contracts like the one Google has with Apple, or potentially barring Google from requiring Android phone makers to include Google apps on their devices.
But beyond those headline-grabbing demands, the government also included provisions that could hobble Google’s future in the competitive race to control the future of AI. The DOJ proposed Google must sell any stakes in AI companies with technology that could compete in search, and divest within six months of a final judgment from the court. The agency also recommended barring any new acquisitions, joint ventures or partnerships with AI companies competing in search.
Notably, if the judge in the case agrees, that could mean forcing Google to sell off its investment in Anthropic, the firm founded by OpenAI defectors in 2021 and could reportedly be valued at up to $40 billion. Last year, Google said it would invest $2 billion in Anthropic, following a $4 billion deal Amazon announced with the company months before. On Wednesday, regulators in the U.K. cleared the investment from Google, saying it wouldn’t conduct a full-scale investigation to scrutinize the deal after an initial probe.
Anthropic is the maker of Claude, a language model that can generate answers to questions, similar to Google’s own Gemini model, which was integrated into Google’s search engine earlier this year. While the startup doesn’t pitch Claude as a search product, those kinds of chatbots are widely seen as a threat to Google search. Other startups, like Perplexity, backed by Nvidia and Jeff Bezos, are more forthright about competing with Google. “It’s a good morning to be Perplexity,” one prominent AI investor told Forbes . Also of note, the DOJ proposal would take Perplexity off the table as a potential Google acquisition target. (Disclosure: Forbes has threatened legal action against Perplexity for plagiarizing our content.)
The filing also proposes that Google gives all publishers and content creators — including those on Google-owned YouTube — a simple way to opt out of having their content be used to train or file-tune Google’s AI models or other AI products, and vow not to retaliate against those who choose to do so.
“The old companies are trying to seize control of the new technology and insulate themselves against displacement.”
John Kwoka, economics and antitrust professor at Northeastern University As artificial intelligence continues to take over the tech world, the government is trying to make sure an emerging and powerful new technology isn’t unfairly dominated by the giant incumbents, said John Kwoka, an economics and antitrust professor at Northeastern University.
“The old companies are trying to seize control of the new technology and insulate themselves against displacement,” he told Forbes . “This is part of a forward-looking proposed remedy.”
But it’s also out of left field, as AI wasn’t a major topic in the case. “It seems so far beyond anything that was in the original case that I can’t take it seriously,” said George Hay, an antitrust professor at Cornell Law School.
Google declined to comment beyond a blog post published Thursday by Google Chief Legal Officer Kent Walker, which calls the DOJ filing an “extreme proposal” that would "chill our investment in artificial intelligence, perhaps the most important innovation of our time, where Google plays a leading role."
While the DOJ proposal is specifically concerned with AI investments that would boost Google in search, the tech giant has investments in other AI companies focused on broader use cases. According to PitchBook, it has a stake in Runway, which builds AI to generate videos, and Tools For Humanity, the company started by OpenAI cofounder Sam Altman, which manages the Worldcoin cryptocurrency and makes AI authentication tools.
Anthropic declined to comment. Runway and Tools For Humanity didn’t immediately respond to requests for comment. Google didn’t answer questions regarding those investments.
It’s also unclear if the divestment proposals would apply to Google parent Alphabet’s two venture firms — GV and CapitalG — since the DOJ case focused squarely on Google and not the other subsidiaries of its parent. GV referred questions to Google, which declined to comment. CapitalG didn’t respond to a request for comment.
The DOJ monopoly case went to trial last year, probing into Google’s search engine, the lifeblood of the company’s sprawling digital advertising business, which generates the vast bulk of parent Alphabet’s $307.4 billion in annual revenue. During proceedings, the federal government argued that Google used several illegal tactics to build and maintain a monopoly in online search, like inking an agreement with Apple worth tens of billions of dollars that made Google the default search engine on iPhones and other Apple products. Google has said its dominant position comes from the quality of its products, arguing it gives consumers easy options to change their defaults. Earlier this year, Judge Amit Mehta ruled against Google, triggering a second trial to determine potential remedies, which is slated to begin in April. Judge Mehta’s decision is expected by next August.
William Kovocic, a former FTC chairman and now a law professor at George Washington University, said Google is likely to argue that the AI restrictions would hamstring the company, leaving a technological opening for China.
Google has been a leader in AI for years, launching its Google Brain lab in 2011, and buying the vaunted AI lab DeepMind in 2014. Three years later, it kicked off the current generative AI wave when Google Brain researchers invented transformers, the AI architecture underpinning Gemini and ChatGPT. But despite the early lead, Google was caught flat-footed when OpenAI released ChatGPT two years ago, beating Google to market with a technology it invented and igniting a global frenzy over AI.
OpenAI was partly aided by its $13 billion deal with Microsoft, which provided support and computing power for the startup. The partnership also revitalized a lumbering Microsoft, leaving CEO Satya Nadella to boast that his company made Google “dance” when Microsoft integrated ChatGPT into its Bing search engine. The DOJ’s AI proposals would bar Google from inking similar partnerships.
But because of Google’s extensive work in the field, it’s unlikely the AI proposals would significantly hold the company back, said Bob O’Donnell, founder of the research firm Technalysis. Unlike Google, Microsoft needed the OpenAI deal because it didn’t have the in-house AI chops. “Even if their hands are tied and they’re prevented from moving forward, they’ve been doing AI longer than anybody,” he said. “I think they’d still be okay.”
Additional reporting by Alex Konrad.

author: Por Andrew Moran
title: Baja empleo de nativos y sube el de inmigrantes en EE.UU.
text: La inmigración en Estados Unidos (tanto legal como ilegal) se disparó en los últimos años, y la afluencia de recién llegados está alterando el estado del mercado laboral nacional. Desde finales de 2019 se dio una divergencia entre los niveles de empleo de los nacidos en Estados Unidos y los nacidos en el extranjero, y la brecha se ha ampliado en el último año. Según la [Oficina de Estadísticas Laborales](https://www.bls.gov/news.release/empsit.t07.htm) (BLS), el número de trabajadores nacidos en el extranjero empleados aumentó en 1.24 millones entre agosto de 2023 y agosto de 2024. En comparación, el número de trabajadores empleados nacidos en Estados Unidos disminuyó en 1.32 millones en el mismo período de tiempo. Si se desglosa por sexos, los hombres estadounidenses han sido los afectados en la tendencia a la baja del empleo de los trabajadores nacidos en el país en los últimos años. En los 12 meses que finalizaron en agosto, el número de trabajadores varones nacidos en EE.UU. descendió en 1.15 millones. La tasa de actividad también se redujo al 65.6 por ciento, frente al 66.2 por ciento de hace un año. Las mujeres estadounidenses perdieron 165,000 puestos de trabajo. Aunque la tasa de participación aumentó un 0.1 por ciento, hasta el 57.9 por ciento, aún no ha recuperado el nivel pre-pandémico del 58.3 por ciento. Por el contrario, los trabajadores varones extranjeros ganaron 695,000 puestos y la tasa de actividad subió un 0.1 por ciento, hasta el 78.7 por ciento. Las mujeres nacidas en el extranjero obtuvieron 546,000 puestos de trabajo, aumentando su tasa de participación del 56.7 por ciento al 57.2 por ciento. Esta ha sido una tendencia a largo plazo, según un [informe](https://cis.org/Report/WorkingAge-Not-Working) de agosto de 2023 de investigadores del Centro de Estudios de Inmigración. La investigación muestra que, de 1960 a 2006, el número de varones estadounidenses y nacidos en el extranjero de entre 16 y 64 años con menor nivel educativo, que formaban parte de la población activa, aumentó en 15.3 millones. Pero sólo el 52 por ciento de ese aumento correspondió a varones estadounidenses, “mientras que el resto fue a parar a hombres inmigrantes”. “Está claro que la demanda de trabajadores varones con menor nivel educativo no ha seguido el ritmo de la población total de hombres con menor nivel educativo, al menos cuando se incluyen los inmigrantes”, afirma el informe. “El resultado ha sido una enorme disminución de la tasa de participación en la fuerza laboral de los nacidos en Estados Unidos”. Los autores del estudio identificaron varias razones para esta tendencia, como el creciente estado del bienestar que puede incentivar el [desempleo](https://es.theepochtimes.com/focus/desempleo), la competencia directa con los inmigrantes y la evolución de las normas sociales. “No cabe duda de que, a medida que aumentaba drásticamente el número de inmigrantes varones en la población activa, también aumentaba drásticamente el número de varones nacidos en Estados Unidos que quedaban fuera de la población activa”, señalan los investigadores del Centro de Estudios de Inmigración. Un [estudio](https://bipartisanpolicy.org/blog/why-some-prime-age-men-are-out-of-work/) de febrero de 2024 del Bipartisan Policy Center examinó por qué los hombres en edad productiva están desempleados. Los investigadores dicen que el 48 por ciento de los que buscan activamente oportunidades de empleo informaron que la “dificultad para encontrar trabajo” era la razón principal por la que todavía estaban buscando. Los problemas de salud fueron otro factor para el 16 por ciento de los encuestados. Por otra parte, el informe señala que el 67 por ciento de los encuestados mencionan las competencias obsoletas, la falta de formación y un historial laboral deficiente como otras causas del desempleo. Le seguían un salario insuficiente (45 por ciento), la distancia al trabajo (43 por ciento) y un seguro médico deficiente o inexistente (30 por ciento). “Apoyar la participación de la población activa de primera edad será vital en medio de un panorama demográfico y económico cambiante en EE.UU.”, concluyeron los investigadores. “Los hombres en edad productiva que están fuera de la población activa se encuentran con varias barreras a largo plazo para trabajar, siendo los problemas de salud y discapacidad los más comunes”. Andrew Crapuchettes, director general de RedBalloon, sugiere que una solución es que los trabajadores estadounidenses “vuelvan a estar dispuestos a hacer los trabajos sucios”. “Una de las razones por las que ha aumentado el número de trabajadores nacidos en el extranjero que obtienen un empleo es porque los hombres estadounidenses están al margen”, explicó Crapuchettes a The Epoch Times, y añade que, según algunas estimaciones, hay 3.5 millones de hombres de entre 25 y 35 años fuera de la población activa. Otros datos sobre inmigración en el mercado laboral La inmigración ha contribuido significativamente a la solidez del mercado laboral estadounidense en los últimos años. De los aproximadamente 158.8 millones de personas que están empleadas, los trabajadores extranjeros representan el 20 por ciento, lo que representa un total de casi 32 millones. Desde febrero de 2020, el crecimiento de la fuerza laboral civil se debe casi en su totalidad a la inmigración. Los economistas de la Brookings Institution [proyectan](https://www.hamiltonproject.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/20240307_ImmigrationEmployment_Paper.pdf) que unos niveles de inmigración más elevados podrían haber mejorado el crecimiento mensual del empleo en nómina en al menos 130,000 puestos de trabajo en 2022 y 2023. Al mismo tiempo, es probable que el Departamento de Trabajo y la Oficina del Censo hayan subestimado estas cifras de empleo debido al “mayor volumen de cruces de indocumentados”, dijo Evgeniya Duzhak, economista del Banco de la Reserva Federal de San Francisco, en un [informe](https://www.frbsf.org/research-and-insights/publications/economic-letter/2024/07/recent-spike-in-immigration-and-easing-labor-markets/#toc_Conclusion) del 15 de julio. De hecho, el Departamento de Trabajo [declaró](https://www.bls.gov/news.release/pdf/empsit.pdf) que la categoría de trabajadores nacidos en el extranjero podría incluir a inmigrantes ilegales. “Es probable que ambas encuestas incluyan al menos a algunos inmigrantes indocumentados. Sin embargo, ni la encuesta de establecimientos ni la de hogares están diseñadas para identificar la situación legal de los trabajadores”, señaló el BLS. Bajo la actual administración, las autoridades estadounidenses han detenido a unos 10.5 millones de personas que cruzaban ilegalmente [la frontera](https://www.cbp.gov/newsroom/stats/nationwide-encounters) en todo el país. [Los datos compilados](https://www.pgpf.org/blog/2024/07/the-foreign-born-labor-force-of-the-united-states) recientemente por la Fundación Peter G. Peterson muestran que la mediana de los ingresos semanales sigue favoreciendo a los trabajadores nacidos en el país, excepto en una categoría: la educación postsecundaria. El año pasado, los ingresos semanales medios de los trabajadores nacidos en Estados Unidos fueron de 1602 dólares, ligeramente inferiores a los de los trabajadores nacidos en el extranjero, que ganaron 1637 dólares. Sin embargo, los analistas del think tank señalan que “la historia cambia” cuando se tienen en cuenta la raza y el origen étnico. “Para los trabajadores blancos, negros y asiáticos, los nacidos en el extranjero ganan ligeramente más que los nativos”, escribió el grupo. “Sin embargo, en el caso de los trabajadores hispanos o latinos, los nacidos en el extranjero ganan sólo 84 centavos por cada dólar que ganan los nativos”. Los expertos debaten las tendencias de la inmigración Un coro de expertos, desde funcionarios de la Reserva Federal hasta economistas del sector privado, ha aludido a las ventajas del auge de la inmigración de los últimos años, sobre todo para el mercado laboral y el panorama económico en general. Las vacantes de empleo han tendido a la baja desde el máximo de 12.2 millones alcanzado en marzo de 2022. Aún así, el número de vacantes es superior al de antes de la pandemia de coronavirus, con un total de 7.67 millones de vacantes ofrecidas en julio. La tasa de actividad aún no se ha recuperado desde antes del desplome económico durante la respuesta a la pandemia. En agosto era del 62.7 por ciento, por debajo del 63.3 por ciento de febrero de 2020. Según un [estudio](https://www.uschamber.com/workforce/understanding-americas-labor-shortage-the-most-impacted-industries) de la Cámara de Comercio de EE.UU., si la tasa de actividad volviera a los niveles pre-pandémicos, la economía “contaría con dos millones de personas más en plantilla”, lo que ayudaría a paliar la escasez de mano de obra que afecta a diversos sectores. Desde principios de 2021, los visados de inmigrante (visados basados en el empleador y visados patrocinados por la familia) se han expedido a niveles casi récord cada mes. Esto, dice Torsten Slok, economista jefe de Apollo Wealth Management, está aliviando los desafíos de oferta de mano de obra del país al tiempo que aumenta la tasa de desempleo. “Tal vez la razón por la que la tasa de desempleo está aumentando es que el Gobierno está resolviendo gradualmente un retraso de solicitudes de visado relacionado con el Covid, lo que aumenta la oferta de mano de obra”, dijo en una nota diaria. En julio, la tasa de desempleo subió al 4.3 por ciento, el nivel más alto desde octubre de 2021. En agosto bajó al 4.2 por ciento. El crecimiento de la inmigración podría haber ayudado a disminuir las presiones inflacionarias, según el presidente de la Fed, Jerome Powell. Aunque señaló que la inmigración es “neutral” para la inflación a largo plazo, “en realidad puede haber ayudado” a corto plazo “porque el mercado laboral se aflojó debido a que había más gente”. “Pero en general, en términos de la inflación agregada, yo no diría que es un conductor de una manera u otra”, dijo Powell en una audiencia del Comité Bancario del Senado en julio. Los economistas de la Fed de Dallas [determinaron](https://www.dallasfed.org/research/economics/2024/0702#:~:text=The%20jump%20in%20jobs%2C%20along,do%20so%20again%20in%202024.) recientemente que el aumento de la inmigración también ha engrosado las cifras de crecimiento económico de Estados Unidos. El aumento de la inmigración añadió un 0.1 por ciento a la tasa de crecimiento del producto interior bruto en 2022 y 2023, y se espera que vuelva a hacer lo mismo este año. Los economistas del banco central regional señalaron que si los niveles de inmigración se normalizan en los próximos años, las tendencias actuales de crecimiento económico serán insostenibles. “La nación se encuentra en una especie de otoño demográfico, y se acerca el invierno”, afirmaron en un documento de julio de 2024. “La jubilación de los baby boomers y el envejecimiento general de la población activa, así como las bajas y decrecientes tasas de natalidad, significan que el crecimiento de la población dependerá totalmente de la inmigración en 2040, ya que las muertes de nacidos en EE.UU. superarán a los nacimientos”. Únase a nuestro canal de Telegram para recibir las últimas noticias al instante [haciendo click aquí](https://t.me/EpochTimesEs) Cómo puede usted ayudarnos a seguir informando ¿Por qué necesitamos su ayuda para financiar nuestra cobertura informativa en Estados Unidos y en todo el mundo? Porque somos una organización de noticias independiente, libre de la influencia de cualquier gobierno, corporación o partido político. Desde el día que empezamos, hemos enfrentado presiones para silenciarnos, sobre todo del Partido Comunista Chino. Pero no nos doblegaremos. Dependemos de su generosa contribución para seguir ejerciendo un periodismo tradicional. Juntos, podemos seguir difundiendo la verdad.

author: Darren Orf
title: Scientists May Have Found Humanity's Sixth Sense-In Our Gut

author: Evans Annang
title: We'll provide Ghana with 100 electric buses by the end of the year - Bawumia | Pulse Ghana
text: Dr Bawumia stated that this initiative aims to reduce carbon emissions as part of the fight against climate change and address rising transportation costs. The Vice President, Dr. Mahamudu Bawumia, has announced that plans are well advanced to procure and import [ 100 electric buses](https://www.pulse.com.gh/news/local/trotro-drivers-push-for-10-increase-in-transport-fares-over-fuel-price-hikes/1vhfv35) into the country by the end of the year. Recommended articles He also mentioned that the government plans to construct charging stations at various fuelling stations to support the new fleet of buses once they arrive in the country. “One of the issues we are looking at as far as reducing the cost of transport in Ghana is that we go through two things: we should move towards electric vehicles, which will help the environment. Also, with electric vehicles, two elements will help all of us: It doesn’t consume fuel. “So, when the price of fuel increases, it will not impact the price of electric vehicles. Again, there are not many spare parts in electric vehicles; the main spare part that will be needed will be the battery, which can last for years. It will reduce the transport cost. “Beginning this month, we are commencing the construction of charging stations because electric vehicles will need charging stations where you can charge your car. We want to place the charging stations in virtually every station’s fuelling stations. “We want Ghana to move towards solar power. So, the charging stations will be hybrid, both solar and electricity, but we want to move towards this by election. This year, we are hoping to bring in close to 100 electric buses to show the public how it is working,” he stated. [Dr. Bawumia](https://www.pulse.com.gh/news/local/govt-has-paid-gh558-million-out-of-its-debt-for-the-2024-bece-waec/dcj15y8) said these at a meeting with members of the Ghana Private Road Transport Union (GPRTU), in Accra. The New Patriotic Party (NPP) flagbearer also explained that the introduction of electric buses will be a public-private partnership.

author: www.ETHealthworld.com
title: Rural health workers' strike enters 13th day, affecting services
text:
Industry- 1 min read
Rural health workers’ strike enters 13th day, affecting services
The officials have asked us to resume duty and then come to discussion, but the past experience makes us wary," said a participant in the protest at Gandhinagar.
Ahmedabad: The healthcare services in rural areas of the state were affected as the healthcare workers' strike entered the 13th day on Thursday. According to employees on strike, about 22,000 workers joined the protest demanding a general resolution (GR) on the
"The syllabus for the departmental examination has nothing to do with our existing service or scope of work assigned to us. The administration assured us of resolving the issue. However, no GR on the same is issued so far," said a senior official associated with the protest.
The second issue is more complex, said protesters, as it will affect over 20,000 employees who are essentially performing tasks that are deemed technical in several other states. The change in pay grade will significantly increase the salary of individual employees, they added.
"The opinion on the same was noted in 2022, but no step is initiated for its implementation. After the start of the protest, employees in nine districts were dismissed, whereas employees of another three districts will face action soon. But we will not budge. The officials have asked us to resume duty and then come to discussion, but the past experience makes us wary," said a participant in the protest at Gandhinagar.
departmental examinationand their inclusion intechnical grade pay."The syllabus for the departmental examination has nothing to do with our existing service or scope of work assigned to us. The administration assured us of resolving the issue. However, no GR on the same is issued so far," said a senior official associated with the protest.
The second issue is more complex, said protesters, as it will affect over 20,000 employees who are essentially performing tasks that are deemed technical in several other states. The change in pay grade will significantly increase the salary of individual employees, they added.
"The opinion on the same was noted in 2022, but no step is initiated for its implementation. After the start of the protest, employees in nine districts were dismissed, whereas employees of another three districts will face action soon. But we will not budge. The officials have asked us to resume duty and then come to discussion, but the past experience makes us wary," said a participant in the protest at Gandhinagar.

author: The Bali Sun
title: Tourists Warned Of Dangerous Weather Conditions Forecast Over Bali
text:
Tourists in Bali this weekend are warned of dangerous weather conditions that are forecast for the coming days.
The forecast through to 2nd November shows potential for extreme weather, including flooding, high waves, and strong winds.
The warnings are especially important for those planning to travel by boat.
The Denpasar Metrology, Climatology and Geophysics Agency (BMKG) has issued weather warnings through to 2nd November as a series of convective clouds gather over the province, triggering heavy rainfall.
The Head of BKMG Bali, Cahyo Nughoro, told reporters, “The public is advised to remain alert to the impacts of extreme weather such as water logging flooding, landslides and fallen trees.”
View this post on Instagram A post shared by Balai Besar MKG Wilayah III (@bmkgbali)
He added, “Fishermen and marine tourism operators must be aware of the potential for increased wind speeds and the highest sea waves that can reach two meters in Bali waters.”
Boat operators have been warned that windspeed could reach 36 kilometers an hour. Heavy rain is forecast for Tabanan, Badung, Gianyar, Klungkung, Bangli, and Denpasar Regency.
These are all home to some of Bali’s biggest tourist resorts, including Sanur, Nusa Dua, Uluwatu, Jimbaran, Kuta, Legian, Seminyak, Canggu, Ubud, and the Nusa Islands.
View this post on Instagram A post shared by Balai Besar MKG Wilayah III (@bmkgbali)
Motorcycle drivers have been warned to avoid driving in the rain and to be extra mindful of falling trees and branches.
A motorcycle driver in Jembrana Regency has already received hospital treatment as a tree fell on them while they were driving.
Fallen trees have also caused traffic delays across the province, with more expected to fall over the weekend and more traffic to build up.
The Head of the Emergency Logistics Team at the Jemrbana Regency Natural Disaster Management Agency, Nyoman Winata, told reporters, “We urge all people to remain vigilant and careful when driving in the midst of extreme weather.”
“Avoid driving when it rains heavily and is accompanied by strong winds, and it is recommended not to take shelter under large trees because there may be a potential for trees to fall.”
View this post on Instagram A post shared by Kantor SAR Denpasar (@basarnas_bali)
On Wednesday night and early Thursday morning, dozens of Denpasar residents experienced serious damage to their rooftops as strong winds hit the capital city.
Tourists planning on marine tourism experiences such as snorkeling, diving, or island hopping, as well as surfing and swimming, are advised to heed the warnings of the Bali, especially in areas like Seminyak, Canggu, Uluwatu, and Nusa Dua, all areas of the coast known to have powerful and unpredictable currents, even when weather conditions are placid.
The Bali Search and Rescue team has tragically confirmed that on Thursday, 31st October, they recovered the body of a student from West Java off the coast of Nusa Penida. The student, who was believed to be visiting Bali with friends, was pulled out by the strong current at Kelingking Beach on Nusa Penida.
Gede Suastra, from the Bali Search and Rescue Alert Unit, told reporters, “The victim was found dead in a westerly direction from the location of the incident, Around 200m from the shore.”
The 17-year-old student and eight friends had been swimming off Kelingking Beach when the tragedy took place.
Suastra told reporters, “Suddenly, a big wave came and swept them away. The other friends managed to save themselves while the victim was lost and swept away by the current.”
Despite a rapid response from the Bali Search and Rescue Response Team, there was little more that could have been done to save the student’s life.
Suastra told reporters, “I would like to thank all Search and Rescue elements involved in the search effort; I also express my condolences to the victim’s family for this incident. Hopefully, this incident will not happen again.”
He called on all beach visitors to pay active attention to the safety signage in place across Bali’s coastlines.
Swimming at Nusa Penida’s Kelingking Beach and Diamond Beach is highly advised against due to the ever-increasing amount of tourist deaths reported from the area.
